title: Carol Vorderman shows off her extraordinary curves in tight jeans at the rugby
text:

Carol Vorderman poured her hourglass curves into a skintight ensemble for the rugby.

The Countdown star, 58, threw her support behind Wales when she wore their colours to the game during the Rugby World Cup 2019, in Japan on Wednesday.

As Wales took on Figi, the stunning game show host ensured all eyes were on her when she put her enviable curves on display.

The TV sensation tucked her rugby shirt into her jeans which were hoisted in with a thick belt to highlight her waist.

Well recognised for her youthful visage, the mathematician arranged her golden curls loosely around her face to draw attention to her natural beauty.

(Image: Twitter)

(Image: Twitter)

Carol littered her Twitter account with a slider of photographs from her visit to Japan during the Rugby World Cup 2019.

She wrote: "We love you OITA #WALVFIJI ...with our @welshrugbyunion boys before the battle begins....omg #CymruAmByth ."

In recent months, she caused quite a stir with her impressive curves but the presenter shot down any claims she has had plastic surgery.

(Image: Twitter)

(Image: Twitter)

(Image: Twitter)

Carol insisted she was the "same old Vorders" when there was a lot of speculation over whether she had surgical enhancements to alter her figure.

However, the blonde bombshell got candid as she discussed how the menopause had changed her shape in a recent segment on Lorraine.

She said: “As you go through the menopause things change. I had what’s called a mirena coil.

“I put on a stone in two weeks. It gives off hormones as well, so I had it removed and it took me a year to lose the weight.

“I went through this terrible hormonal depression, and I don’t use that word lightly, it really was awful.”

The TV beauty found fame on Countdown in 1982 and she has been firmly in the limelight ever since.
description: Carol showcases her hourglass figure as she threw her support behind Wales during Rugby World Cup 2019
